main.name: Joshua Chai
main.bio: Motivated and technically skilled Masterâ€™s student in Software Engineering at the UWA, with a strong foundation in full-stack development. Proficient in web technologies, including React, Django, ect., as well as data analytics tools like Python and R. Known for effective teamwork and delivering results in dynamic environments.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description:
1. Developed automated scripts for large-scale image data cleaning, ensuring data integrity and quality.
2. Collaborated with researchers and senior engineers to design efficient data pipelines for subsequent model training.
3. Conducted exploratory data analysis (EDA) using Python (Pandas, NumPy) to identify and address data anomalies in ophthalmic images.

work.title: Committee Member
work.description:
1. Participated in strategic planning and decision-making for community tech initiatives.
2. Helped coordinate team operations, recruitment, and internal communications.

work.title: Front-End Developer
work.description:
1. Built interactive web applications with React and Tailwind CSS, improving UI performance.
2. Improved front-end workflow efficiency by implementing reusable components and state management.
3. Worked with designers and back-end developers to optimize UX and site responsiveness.

work.title: International Student Ambassador
work.description:
1. Developed strong cross-cultural communication skills, fostering collaboration in diverse teams.
2. Represented StudyPerth at key student events, enhancing public speaking, networking, and leadership abilities.

education.school: Heilongjiang University of Science and Technology

education.degree: Certificate of Achievement in the Digital Media and IT Program

projects.title: Health Data Analysis
projects.description: Developed ML models to analyse global health data, transitioning from classification to clustering techniques.

projects.title: Smart Pet Feeder
projects.description: An IoT system that automates water refilling and monitors pet health using Raspberry Pi and sensors.

projects.title: Personal CV
